Comment: Never give Jones credit. He's a frothing at the mouth idiot, but he knows what he's doing. This will get him a round of comparatively good press and people going "even Alex Jones says [this basic-ass take everyone already said]!" That's what he wants. He does it every 6 months or so for something, and there's always a string attached. If you're a sane person, you're never actually agreeing with Alex Jones even if it appears you're standing in the same place.  He's always working an angle, he always lies.  For example, not too long after the Oct 7th attacks, he got a round of this "even Alex Jones is saying!" press because without context and following the depth of what stupid shit he's actually saying, it sort of looked like he was saying Israel should exercise more caution when bombing in Gaza. But what he was *actually saying* was "Israel should exercise more caution when bombing in Gaza... **because** the globalists, the evil Democrats, and the World Economic Forum are working together to import every military aged male in Gaza into America as refugees, and then will give them all guns and have them patrol polling places and steal the election."  This is why it's never worth it to go "even Alex Jones says!" There's always a string attached. And it's not as if he's ever giving a take so unique and incisive that we have no choice to highlight his great words. The words he is saying are only noteworthy because he is saying them and is such a ghoul.

Comment: I think the "online left's" interest in this story is more a response to how the "online right" has tried to use it to bludgeon the left with it in fits and starts every x years.    It's not the "left" or the Biden administration that was staging Epstein influencer reveal parties with their favorite Twitter and Youtube personalities, and it's wasn't the "online left" that is still clamoring for "the Epstein Files' to be released in some sort of showy fashion to splash across their channels for perceived political points.   What the online left IS befuddled about is how the "online right" can be so convinced that this is the story of the century while totally oblivious to Trump's well-documented entanglements with Epstein, and they are just gobsmacked that the "online right" wants to hammer leftie pols with Epstein innuendo while handwaving away Trump's own connections.  Listen, I'm not gonna sit here and tell you that justice for Jeffery Epstein  victims and prosecution for Epstein cronies more the good of mankind has been a core principle of the left for decades - it clearly hasn't.  That said, the "left" has done what they do - they work appropriately to prosecute people that deserve prosecution.  Are the left above petty political slander?  Fuck no.  But they also don't shut their eyes and cover their ears when one of their own is absolute scum, generally speaking.      Anyway, bottom line-  I'm just not going to agree when you try and tell me that the right isn't exploiting this whole thing WAY more than the left ever has.   There are a few things I think are true:  1) Some High-ranking pols in both parties would suffer in an honest, thorough examination of the Epstein client list.  2) Innocent victims would be revealed  3) The full files will not ever be released because DJT is all. over. them.  4) There are some hardcore MAGA media types that honestly believe that all Dems are pedos, and the Epstein files are full of mainly Dem names.  They are wrong.  4a) Bondi has seen the files and knows that the facts are significantly different (and likely would harm Trump)  AND/OR 4b) Feds at SDNY are pros and have no desire to contribute to a political circus and have probably warned her that she would open a can of worms that she wants no part of .
